subject: Law
title: What Is International Law?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is International Law?.

hook.text: No world government exists. Yet nations follow shared rules on trade, war, and diplomacy. How?

buildup.text: International law is the set of rules and principles that govern relations between states and other global actors.

discovery.text: It covers treaties, customs, human rights, trade, the environment, and the laws of armed conflict.

twist.text: There's no international police force. Compliance relies on diplomacy, reputation, and sometimes economic pressure.

climax.text: Despite no enforcer, most nations comply most of the timeâ€”because cooperation benefits everyone.

punchline.text: No government. No police. Yet the rules mostly work.

quiz.question: Why do most nations comply with international law?
options: A global police force compels them
